posts.com:
NEW RULES:
No offtopic posts. No /pol/ shit. No infighting. No Spam. No tripfag/namefags. No narcissists.

Welcome to the Nobody General

The idea of being the chosen one is often romanticized in media and society. We see it in movies, books, and even in real life - people who are chosen to fulfill some sort of prophecy or destiny - but let me tell you, it's not all it's cracked up to be.

First of all, it's a lot of pressure. Being the chosen one means that you have a heavy burden to bear. You feel like you have to be perfect all the time, because you're supposed to be the one to fix everything. You're constantly worried about making mistakes or letting people down. It can feel like the weight of the world is on your shoulders, and that's not something that everyone can handle.

Secondly, it's an isolating, lonely experience. You can't quite just be yourself, because you have a role to play. You can't let your guard down, or show any weakness. You're constantly on display, and it's exhausting. You can't really confide in anyone, because no one will believe you, or information must be kept hidden. You're always the one who has to make the tough decisions, and you have to do it alone. You have to be strong and brave, even when you're feeling anything but.

Finding out that you're a direct descendant of King David, Napoleon, Hitler, or whoever it may be, is a lot to take in, and it's overwhelming. Every day afterwards you will feel the need to live up to expectations.

Most of all, it means constantly being in danger. There are always those who want to take you down, who envy you or see you as a threat to their power and control. They will stop at nothing to eliminate you, and you can never truly trust anyone.

So, if you're thinking about calling yourself the chosen one, think again. It's not all it's cracked up to be.
It's okay to just be yourself and live your own life. You don't have to be the chosen one to make a difference in the world.

>>33746013
One Piece is literally an antidote to cynicism.
I used to work night shifts as a medic at a rehab. The kid who got me into One Piece saved my life and my soul. I had one patient who marathoned OP during his recovery and I wound up marathoning it with him.
The whole thing just RADIATES optimism harder than any other piece of media I have encountered. I was young and underpaid and working the graveyard shift.
This one patient of mine marathoned One Piece while I had him. His leg got busted up along with his addiction. We had him for longer. His leg was broken so I made him a splint and helped him walk again. The dealers had beaten him up and robbed him. I was a young medic working at a legally questionable rehab so all I could do was make him a splint and change his compression bandages each night.
All I was doing all night was responding to overdoses and suicides. This one kid who I had as a patient for like 3 weeks got to Enies Lobby with me while I just changed his bandages for a few weeks and stayed up late with him watching.
In all seriousness, the whole "DAIJOBU" that the 5th opening opens with kept me sane while I was responding to fucking suicides for 17 an hour. I know I'm not supposed to make friends with patients, but thanks, Josh. You dunno how much you helped me. I think you healed me and not the other way around.

What's very, very interesting to me is that Joyboy/Nika, as a entity, is likely inspired by hindu mythology.
>Luffy, prior to the reveal regarding Nika being a freedom-loving sun god, was explicitly compared to a god once during Wano; he was referred to resembling a guardian deity while in Gear 4th, specifically Bùdòng Míngwáng (chapter 990). This s vaguely important because while guardian deities are well known, it's notable because Luffy has, well, a DF related to a in-universe deity, but we have a established base of sorts; Oda is working in the framework of eastern religions when he's coming up with his in-universe deities
>Joyboy's only living companion is Zunisha, a giant elephant, was his companion; hinduism has a concept known as Vahana, which is basically a divine mount which often has bizarre features and often have their own stories (such as being demons forced into service, ect).
>There's a modest chance for Joyboy to be partially inspired by a Javanese king named Jayabaya; Jayabaya was a Javanese ruler who reigned over a golden age of prosperity and peace and who also created various prophecies, and was considered a incarnation of Vishnu in his lifetime due to being considered a Ratu Adil, or prophesied hero-figure . This is mostly notable because Jayabaya figured into Imperial Japanese propaganda when they occupied Java during WW2 as someone who supposedly predicted the occupation of Java under the Japanese as a positive for the Javanese

posts.sub: I think my neighborhood has something evil in it
posts.com:
Do you ever feel like there is something evil possibly stalking where you live? I’ve had this kind of experience time and time again. I want to tell myself it’s all in my head, but I do believe in some extent of the supernatural. There is an evil I sense in the presence of my own home.

I live in a quiet neighborhood by a manmade lake and have for over a decade and a half with my intermediate family. There is a lot of swamp land nearby, and trees cover much of your field of vision. Despite the amount of housing, it’s usually pitch dark at night. You can hear vehicles off in the distance, but often the only noises I hear are wildlife and a stray dog here or there. It’s when it goes dead silent that I feel the evil presence and lose a sense of comfort.

When I lay in bed, sometimes I hear what sound like alien noises outside, like out of a movie. I tried to tell myself I was hearing things, but I could pinpoint no simple origin for these sounds. We do have aircraft that fly overhead sometimes to and from a nearby airport, but these noises don’t sound like planes in nature. I have some form of ADHD and find myself on the spectrum, but don’t show the signs of schizophrenia. The noises have lessened in recent memory, but the thought of them still haunts me.

Sometimes I would have dreams of an evil entity residing in or around the lake. I have been on a number of travels, yet I’ve never felt quite the same dangerous vibes I do out in my own backyard. I constantly feel something could be stalking me and act careful to head in quickly when the crickets stop chirping and the frogs stop croaking.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33773517
We had an outdoor cat who mysterious disappeared when I was younger. We speculate he might have been taken by accident in a worker’s truck, but at the same time there’s no tangible proof of this. Our last outdoor cat would head into our garage one day and pass away right there on the floor. He had no signs at all of ailments or injury and had acted fine the previous day. An unknown internal failure? Perhaps, it can happen. All we know is that it was sudden.

Our neighborhood isn’t free from disasters. We’ve had several wrecks nearby, with one person even driving straight into the lake in a suspected suicide. It was quite a sudden tragedy.

Recently there has been more construction around this part and more housing. Just recently people have been working on a seemingly random part of the road. It was supposed to take a couple of days, but turned into weeks. I have seen no explanation for this large delay, although we are known for having rougher roads. Could have just been the government being incompetent. Nothing new, right?

There have been times when I’m outside, and I see a dark shadowy figure seemingly stalking me from the bushes. Tricks of the eyes? Maybe, but they seemed really real in the moment and it’s happen on multiple occasions. It’s usually in the evening these figures seem to appear. Could always be lighting, but these figures don’t appear to be shadows of nearby objects.

One time a while back, I went outside and was confronted with a massive bug that appeared to be a red and yellow cross between a fly and bee. It began to zoom toward me before I ran in and stayed inside the rest of the day. I never could explain this phenomena. A hallucination. It had to be, but from what?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33773523
There are some odd characters in our neighborhood. One couple lives in a home with a strange basement, only a couple windows giving glimpses within. To this day, I do not know what they do for a living. Just recently, a couple neighbors moved in from up north. They seem normal at first glance, but I hear them building at times. What I know not. One of them will always say “Hi”, only to repeat it upon exiting from within the house. The two have had a lot of strange shippings in my experience, and have had lengthy travels at times. I feel vibes from their house that aren’t outright evil, but certainly not natural.

It’s worth noting our town has a military history. There’s even been a couple accidents with explosives very close by that could have potentially destroyed the whole town. Sometimes I wonder if there’s more to this place than meets the eye.

The worst part is in my own home. There have been times at night I’ve heard noises or felt a pure sense of malice go over me. I’ve had to hide in the bathroom on some nights in fear of an entity hunting me down. My animals have acted odd at times in our home and out in the yard. Our dog in particular will often bark toward the darkness with no obvious target in sight. He does this on a regular basis now.

My family has gotten more aggressive since we moved into this house. I myself have not been free from furthered fury, but my parents are in a far worse state. Sometimes they seem possessed by pure and vigilant anger before calming down to the point where they forgot being angry in the first place. It’s quite terrifying from my perspective.

I plan to move soon, and hopefully will no longer feel this fear so often. Am I deluded and maybe a bit crazy? Perhaps I am. Do I believe we can sometimes sense evil nearby? Even if it’s somewhat foolish, I do and always will.

I'll tell you an abridged version of my story, and it's probably the only time I will share it on /x/ so if you care for some reason pay attention!

When I first recovered my consciousness enough after incarnating to have continuous coherent thoughts, it came to my attention almost immediately that something was very wrong.
It happened first when I looked in a mirror. It was a visceral sensation, like an imploding void in my chest coupled with extreme confusion and distress. Something about my own consciousness, my body, my reality just seemed... off.. I still feel it when looking in mirrors sometimes, although it has become *EXCEEDINGLY rare*

Anyways, this feeling lit a fire in my heart that never died: I had to know WHY. WHY am I. HOW am I. I just had to, because I felt at the deepest level that only when I found the answer to it would I be able to live, love, and die in peace.

Playful, extremely curious, intuition/instinct reliance combined with logical/intelligent thought (cunning+cleverness, I would say to put it more briefly), very "jumpy" (as in I have always loved jumping and jumping down from places very very much) combined with a strong instinctual sense of danger. (Chapter 4)
I was meditating, sleeping in the back of a SUV. I don't remember my exact thought process, but I finally made my first realization.
I said to myself "I'm not human. I don't know what I am or how this is possible, but I am not human.. At least not in the same way as others are."
Thereafter I finally achieved something I had pursued for years: Silence. Integration with the senses. It was shortlived, but a massively important spiritual/meditative milestone. It was the first time I ever experienced "thinking through(by) my sensations", for lack of any better way of explaining the feeling. Some anons may know what I mean.
My next milestone happened when I was meditating in my tent. I considered seriously for the very first time a strange concept.
"...Am I a fox?" "In any way, even if not in a literal sense?"
So I decided to test it.
"I am a fox. I am a fox. I am a fox..." "A pure, wild fox.." I mantra'd to myself..
I visualized my fox self, moving around, exploring my environment. I felt this rush of excitement and joy. I was brilliantly happy.
Eventually I came out of it, and something beautiful had happened.
That void which haunted me my whole life was finally gone. I was free of it. Sure, I still beared the weight of the trauma of my human life, but I was at least finally free of that "burning void" I was so happy. I ran out into the field nearby, and just ran around and sang and danced. I was so brilliantly happy.
I didn't fully accept my nature yet, but I became convicted in at least 2 things:
1: That I am a fox, at least in SOME sense. Even if I am just a "fox-like man", I am still a fox.
2: That I wanted to dedicate my life to the benefit of foxkind. (Though, I still try to help humans too, when I can and I think they are worth helping)
Around this time I experienced some strange things, mainly having to do with my body... Probably unrelated, but still weird syncronicities.

I was always a bit of an underdeveloped looking guy. My muscles were lacking, my mustache was pathetic, my voice was higher pitched than I would have liked, and my general fat distribution and skeletal structure made me look really young.
I was 6'3 and had went through and finished puberty long, long before this incident.

Story continues.
After this, I met a real fox spirit for the first time. Believe me or not, *I* believe me. It finally set me free from spiritual doubt, I knew magic and the otherworldy was real. I felt, again, freed.

Now, I had a dedication. A burning fire in my heart burning *outwards* instead of inwards. The dissonance with my world started to ease as I slowly came to understand.
I was able to overcome some of my traumas; my faith and conviction allowed me to finally face people who had hurt me, to go off on my own, and also allowed me to finally quit a very harmful (drug-unrelated) compulsive act.
This started a period of healing and growth for me, I was becoming my own sovereign being in this world. I began to understand my place.

Then over the Christmas work shutdown, I meditated a lot and finally reached a massive spiritual realization, I could only refer to it as an enlightenment. I felt this inexplicable feeling of joy, relief, and deep sorrow. All I could do for a few hours was laugh and cry at once. I really felt *lighter*.
As a part of this enlightenment, I finally accepted it. "I *am* a fox soul."
With that, it all fell together. I understood my past, came to a certain level of peace with my present, and a real sense of hope for my future.
My dissonance with the world almost entirely vanished; I realized my place. It was incredible.
I was blessed. (6/6+1)

Look, anon, I understand that trauma and other bad life experiences may affect us in ways that our very beings seem to become an obstacle between us and the world.

When that happens, we may find comfort in explore our sense of identity. We might even find relief in unexpected aspects of our personality.

But the fact of the matter is that abstractions such as identity are just outdated constructs of modern culture made to address mental diseases by early psychology. There was no sense of "mental identity" before that. We always were what we were, and the only solid reference we've always had of self was the concrete facts of our own lives.

I'm a human because I'm an animal that can reason. I'm a man because I was born with a penis. I am in my 20s because I was born 20 something years ago. What you will find as you explore your sense of identity is that, in fact, being abstract, it is, by itself, without a frame of reference and, therefore, ever-changing. That is why "identity" explorers eventually reach ridiculous abstractions. Self-absorption is the problem.

posts.name: Peribsen
posts.com:
>>33753607

So to the first bit regarding evolution happening differently in space than on the ground, or in a cave. Ionizing radiation. There's a large amount of research already done on how radiation changes genetic properties of these fungi. Look up Chernobyl and Cryptococcus. That's the same cryptococcus neoformans that is proving to be a deadly pathogen by the way. There are other studies related to virulence increase after radiation exposure, I believe that was saccharomyces but it's another dimorphic and human pathogenic yeast so same logic applies.

Now put a species in space, where there's no atmosphere to shield against rads. The right conditions and spores could survive dessicated for an extremely long time. Meteor hits a water supply, just for example, and now you've got panspermia. Difficult odds? Sure, but not anymore than the odds of a new species just popping up out of nowhere. The clades that were mentioned for Candida Auris are odd because they showed up roughly simultaneously but had already been through enough generations to be distinct genetically.

Vancouver 1999 that was mentioned a thread or two ago is another good key in for panspermia. A large scale Cryptococcus Neoformans outbreak (largest ever for overgrowth in immunocompetent population actually) that still has no satisfactory explanation.

And sure you're going to run into resistance in the settings of concern you mentioned. But that's very different than a species just popping up en masse in areas it shouldn't be in.

I really think that consideration needs to be given to the cave origins as well. I stand by the origin point of dimorphic fungi being potentially not here originally though. They don't line up with the other fungi very well and have some odd traits. Like keying in on 95F for certain biological processes, being able to survive environments that standard dimorphic fungi can't, and even having multi stage processes to obtain energy/ATP from a living host.

posts.name: Peribsen
posts.com:
>>33753607

And on the Taforalt bit.

It's an interesting dig site and it's well known to be the oldest human dumping ground. Concurrent use is about 360K years. And the oldest genetic material in all of Africa to date comes from that exact site. And for whatever reason they decided keeping pigeons was a good idea. The caves are known for it, and pigeons are specifically known as carriers of zoonotic yeasts - candida and cryptococcus in particular.

Here's why it's so key to what I focus on. I believe that humans were actually better at immune function in the past. For some pathogens like the type of fungi we're studying, that may not have been that long ago overall.

There's are specific immune responses that get leveraged by these fungi. Primarily th-17s are the cells affected and errors there allow inflammation to go haywire. The way this plays into the dates from Taforalt is the population that resided there had high 90% rate of dental cavities. Cavities and dental issues for inflammation and decay are now being tied to candida as the catalyst (and I'll bet a couple others show up under scrutiny). Candida started the party, the rest of the germs show up to join in.

Now here's the tally. You can't have tooth decay in its accepted definition without candida present. If your immune system is functioning correctly your th-17s should be able to take care of fungal spores way before tooth decay ever sets in. However, the population at Taforalt is the earliest record of a population having a massive amount of tooth decay at around 17,500 years ago. And at a rate of 97%. There is not an earlier record of these types of cavities at this scale available, once there is I'll be revising my research appropriately.

It all boils down to firsts. Taforalt is the earliest genetic record of humans in Africa, it is the earliest record of massive dental failures thousands of years before agriculture, and there is a zoonotic disease vector present for nearly 20,000 years.

>>33760386
I use a foot bath with 2tbsp. Borax (20 mule team unscented), 2tbsp baking soda and also dump some ACV in there.

Before you soak your feet, rough up the nails in question with a nail file. Soak for 40 minutes or so, so the nail softens up. Then nail file it again, apply oregano essential oil to the top of the nail and under the nail (drip down). If you do this a few times it will be dead. It just takes awhile for the healthy nail to grow back.

Start with a new pair of shoes after that, and use a mixture of borax and baking soda for a foot powder. Put some in your socks and some in your shoes.

It works. You just have to be patient as new nail growth takes time.

posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33705047
sit down.
close eyes (personally recommended)
Place tongue gently on roof of mouth.
Focus on the breath going in and out of your nose.
If any kind of sensation/thought/distraction comes up, note it with a simple label (whatever comes first/is natural) and gently return back to the breath.
Don't control anything, just watch your breath going in and out like you were cloud watching.

posts.com:
I've been meditating for years now and yet I can't really put into words what meditation is, I like the "meditation is deliberate focus of awareness" thing that people usually talk about.

Cultivating the ability to focus takes time. Focusing on the breath or a candle are the 2 basic exercises people recommend, it teaches you to "feel" and "observe" which are different from "thinking", it may take months to snap out of the "thinking" mode for just a second but that sole second is enough to show you that your thinking mind is not you nor your reality, it's like a radio which plays all the time and you were living with that radio open for most of your life.

>>33699233
For me the "observer" focus/mode is when you are not a slave to your thoughts and you are calmer thus you don't get dragged away by them, while the "focus" focus is the ability to focus on one thing with all your might, I say that those 2 go hand-in-hand and maybe someone could say that they are the same thing: the ability to take a step back from everything, be calm and direct your focus/observing whatever you want.

Also during my sits I remember how to feel my feelings. Feelings inhabit your body and you can feel them better if you focus on them, they usually carry forgotten memories or various insights and blissful states if you focus on them enough.

Meditation is a paradox to me, it's like a means to an end but also the end itself, it's like a vehicle which takes you places but also it's just erasing all the unnecessary noise around you to realize that all those places were always here next to you.

So sit and watch your breath, feel your body breathing, your mind will make thousands of stories about anything but just let it be, don't even label those thoughts, don't even say "I'm letting them go", just let them be and focus on your breath, on the feeling of your body breathing, your mind will say "that's stupid, analyzing these important things is better", but just focus on the breath.

>>33710828
What you say makes sense but from my own experiences I 'd say that those 2 are the same thing.

Focusing is like an ability, people are good at it or not.

You can be focused on just this moment and your surroundings without being focused on a single object. This is like being totally present, you are focused on the present, your mind isn't wandering outside of your control, thoughts may pop up but they don't take you away in daydreaming (which most people have but don't realize). Imagine that this focusing ability is like a magnifying glass, let's say that what I just described is the point "zero" of the magnifying glass, our basic reality. This is what you called the "observer" mode.

However you can zoom into one single thing using that magnifying glass, say your breath or an object. You can literally move your entire consciousness towards that thing to the point that your awareness travels there, some people say that "wizards/shamans/yogis" can move their entire consciousness towards that object and move it with their will or inhabit the body of an animal, others say that they can zoom their eyesight so much to the point that they look at the atoms of an object, some even say that they hypnotize others through this way. This is the point "1" of the glass.

Conversely you can even zoom out, you can become the whole room and even look at yourself from above, you can become your whole house and the whole city, you can focus on the whole galaxy and the whole cosmos, you can even break the linear time illusion and realize that everything is one single moment which takes place here and now. Let's say that this is the point "-1" of the glass.

That's what meditation is: Realizing that you are everything at the same time, your awareness can go everywhere since you are part of the whole, the ego is an illusion, break free from it and realize that you are whole, ignore your thoughts which most of the time are just the ego talking nonsense.

>>33699233
This post made me want to share something semi-related - an experience of mine:

For years I always wondered if non-directive meditation is the same as directive meditation, or if one was better than the other or even the "correct way to meditate".

In the non-directive kind you just sit and be aware, if something pops up you just watch it until it goes away without making stories in your mind about it.

In the directive aka focus meditation you focus on a single object and you stay with it, if something else pops up you immediately return to the object.

After practicing both for a long time I can say one thing: They both have the same result which is your thinking mind eventually quieting down, the thoughts become less and less and you are left in silence and that's when the real fun begins.

(continued in the next post)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33726002
(cont.)

I could say that non-directive would be better suited for advanced practitioners who can manage their thoughts better and are better at not being dragged away from their wandering mind, those are the practitioners who are more grounded, whose their breath is 24/7 calm. That's the "observer focus" you are talking about.

Directive is better for people who are new to meditation, those people are usually overthinkers, their breath patterns are all over the place, I'd suggest that someone who begins meditation focuses on his belly expanding or his chest or on the feeling the air makes in his throat. I suggest this because in an overthinking beginner the thoughts are coming at a very fast and strong rate. Imagine this kind of meditation like you holding on a steel pole with all your might so the tornado (thoughts) won't drag you away. That's the "focusing focus" you talked about.

So it all comes down to having a calm mind, and sitting will do this anyway, sit in the dark with no sound or anything to bother you and the thoughts WILL stop, what really helps is if you also incorporate breathwork and physical exercise in your everyday life and if you reduce screen usage (which fills your mind with lots of information), these will help you reach the "no-thought" state faster.

I remember sitting down to do "Focus on breath" meditation and various memories and bad feelings popped up, I ignored them and returned to the breath, then thoughts like "You are ignoring what's important!" popped up and I became anxious that I was using meditation to run away from my problems but I knew that I wasn't really doing that and that was just my overthinking mind not wanting to stop. Most of our problems are just thoughts in our minds and are not real at all.

So just sit and focus on the breath or on the moment, or on your body, don't think too much about it, thoughts and words are not everything, feeling is also important, feeling this moment here now.

Start with objects that are in another room from where you are. Then move on to physical settings in the house, imagine whole rooms and whole layouts of the house. Next, move to things that are outdoors like a park, a lake, forest or other natural settings of the sort. After that move to more dynamic situations like a busy city center, a school campus between classes when there's a lot of people walking everywhere, a busy restaurant, etc. After than imagine scenarios with yourself and other people who are immediately with you where you give each person unique physical attributes, personality traits and have them say the certain things you want them to say.

Literally that simple. Should take you sometime.

>>33732995
Shut off your PC monitor, close your laptop, back away from the desk.

Sit up right but remain in a relaxed position. Close your eyes. Take a deep breath through your nose and feel as the air travels down through your lungs and you expand your belly to fullness. Holy for 3 seconds, then slowly exhale through your pursed lips. Repeat twice more. Feel relaxed and just let your thoughts flow. Don't get in their way, just let them happen, sit back and observe. Keep breathing normally through your nose and continue to let your thoughts happen, sit back and observe them. Do this for the next 5 minutes.

There. You've done mindfulness meditation and you are going to feel better after the 5 minutes are up. Do this for the next few weeks and write down any worries, anxieties, intrusive thoughts, or recurring themes that run through your mind while meditating.

That's literally all you have to know right now. Meditation is one of those things that are better of just experiencing from the get got instead of reading about them. You can do body scan meditations, mantra meditations, visualization meditation and KUNDALINI BRO later. No need to complicate things.

Keep reading and lurking the thread for resources.

>>33744644
I'm the same anon who said that quitting coffee helps, I'm here with new things you can consider:

- Maybe your volition is not that strong? Maybe you just sit and you hope that something happens? Maybe instead of trying to focus on your breath you half-ass it and your mind takes you over all the time? You have taken notice that you are indeed mind wandering, you have taken the first step of observing this - a step which many humans never take in their whole life - so why you don't act? Why your mind keeps on being the leader?

- Maybe your thoughts seem like they are extremely important and you can't ignore them? If yes then write them down after each session and really ask yourself: Is this important now? Most of the time it isn't, it's most likely a past semi-traumatic event which keeps on repeating in your head, or a worry about the future, ignore them both, the now is the most important thing.

- Maybe you are trying to focus on your breath through your thinking mind? That's too narrow, try to FEEL, like literally feel your whole body breathing, the breath fills your lungs only but it also moves your belly and your pelvic floor with its movements, your shoulder blades and clavicle may also move during inhalation/exhalation, feel your whole body sitting there and breathing.

- Speaking of the body, try to keep your head retracted (search about this head posture), also imagine a thread which is attached in the middle of your head pulling it lightly up, this head position helps with sleepiness.

- Again: Don't make a story about it, it's just you breathing, yes you will just sit there and feel yourself breathing, your mind will think "What? Only that? That's too simple/stupid/whatever", but believe me: first achieving calmness and silence is the most important thing.

- And last: Coffee is not the only thing which may hinder your meditation practice, everyday cannabis smoking or regular pills may hinder it too.

>>33744644
Everyone is saying that you should focus on your breath and maybe it works for some people but I will speak about my own experience: I was trying for years to concentrate just like you and I just couldn't, then I decided to just sit and accept in silence without trying to fight or force anything nor direct my focus 100% on something, just observe myself in silence.

I did that because I knew that I had unresolved childhood trauma inside of me, I was full of anger and anxiety most of the day and even during meditation, it was like a huge alarm which was ringing for years now and I wasn't doing anything about it.

This way of meditating did indeed have some kind of focus but it was more of a calm, "sit back and relax" kind of focus in which I was just being aware of everything that came, some people call this "transcendental meditation" or "mindfulness" I think.

So you could say that my object of meditation was my thoughts which were usually various past experiences which I had the tendency to remember all the time or even made-up scenarios. Nearly all of those thoughts carried hateful feelings with them and my mind wanted to live out those scenarios which they usually ended up in me beating up someone who had mistreated me, I had violence and hate inside of me (all from my abusive childhood).

However as I said before in my meditations I didn't sit to fight or force things but I sought to observe in silence, so every time this pull came, this pull towards violence - this pull towards making more thoughts and extending the scenario - I choose instead to just sit, and what I saw was fear that the other person was mistreating me and I wasn't doing anything, this feeling of fear was so strong which was almost unbearable and it took me many meditations to finally resolve it.

So as >>33744852 said, yeah I was probably using meditation as a way to escape those alarming feelings of hate and fear.

Maybe something similar is happening to you? Who knows.

posts.name: Amitabhanon

>>33763403
Specifically because I'm interested in the pure land of sukhavati.
Pure lands are not realms, they're rather a sort of purified form of samsara. Intrinsically linked to the "pure mind". Meaning that sukhavati or any pure land doesn't have to be experienced after death. It can manifest for you in the here and now.
Sukuavati being the easiest to get into, I'm going to attempt to get into it while still alive.
If I can "get in" while alive, I'll be in the perfect place to practice.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33754655
Another anon here. Night time meditations are hard because dreams mess things up, if this is a problem try morning and early evening meditations.
Dreams are not a reason to stop the session because most fascinating trance states can be found when almost falling asleep in meditation, but the goal of the session clearly changes.
At most repeat only once before progressing and later return back if you feel like it. The tapes are clearly too short so meditating before starting one or returning back to the beginning after a few minutes can help.

Despite starting with a restless mind I have had great success. The best parts have happened after the tape has ended, when it gets to the wake up part I disconnect headphones and keep going.
Meditative states aren't interrupted by simple actions, trance clearly vanishes for a bit when moving a hand around but it always comes back in like 15 seconds when ignoring the disruption.
Good dedication. If you have questions about the tapes don't ask them because you are thinking instead of surrendering to the relaxation, do what you feel like.

posts.name: The Nobody
posts.com:
>>33771353
>why is the whole thing tied to feeling dread?
Emotions are created by the brain in response to physical sensations, and they are modulated by the context in which they are felt. Dread however, is only in small part an emotion. It is largely a pain reflex and an attention modifier. This is what makes dread so difficult to deal with, it amplifies its own emotional context.

As for why sleep paralysis is comes with dread, it's because of the physical discomfort. You are restrained, your heart is stressed, and your breathing is strained. Through proper attention and awareness all of these physical discomforts can be lessened / ignored. The dread can dissipate, and it can even become a thing of the past. These were my experiences.

That's the most important part. Dread restricts one's attention and generally produces paranoid thoughts as a consequence. Simply calming down is often not enough to counteract the demand dread puts on one's attention. There is a mastery of focus that comes in to play as well.

I have had experiences that I would like to understand.

I heard from a tv show that sleep paralysis happens when you wake up from a nightmare.

I have experienced waking up from a nightmare with sleep paralysis and a sense of a threatening presence, perhaps a looming darkness or dark figures and a feeling of fear. That all went away when I had asserted my will and managed to move, breaking out of that state.

However, I also experienced something else when I was a child.

Sometimes while trying to fall asleep, shadowy figures dragged me to a flaming pit blocking the doorway to my room and down the "fire hole" (as I called it as a child) into a nightmare. I had nightmares multiple times a week, and this is how many of them began, like a frame tale.

I was scared, suffering, and losing sleep. That may be how my insomnia started. I could run to my parents to tell them and get a hug, but I still had to escape from these nightmares that I occasionally got dragged into by figures similar to the presence or presences I sensed during sleep paralysis.

I started lucid dreaming as defense against all the nightmares, and sometimes I could control the dream. Usually after going lucid, I wake up, because I realized that I was dreaming.

Sometimes I would get stuck in a nightmare and have fight to get out. One time I was stuck in like Escher Battlezone 2 (from like Win 95) but all the lines were burning red, and there were dark figures that looked like the ones that dragged me into that nightmare. I thought they wanted to keep me there and hurt me. So I imagined summoning a tank, (I was like 10 so a tank seemed like the most powerful option even in the non-euclidian geometey of the landscape, plus it's mobile.) So i blasted the presences (honestly they looked like straight up Grays except red and black instead of gray.)

I have varied dreams now and few nightmares, and sometimes I lucid dream. I am also schizoaffective but that was not until I turned 29. Mabye irrelevant.

>Who is Michael Aquino?

Michael A. Aquino was a lieutenant colonel of the US Army, and he was employed in the Army's psychological operations division in San Francisco. Aquino wrote the influential book on psychological operations called Mindwar.

Michael Aquino was also the founder and high priest of the Temple of Set, a satanist religious organization that broke away from the Church of Satan due to disputes that included the Temple of Set worshipping a literal Satan and practicing magic that is considered by members to have supernatural power. He was born in 1936 and died in 2019.

Information on Aquino has been scrubbed from the internet recently (https://www.reddit.com/r/conspiracy/comments/6wvpqy/lt_col_michael_aquino_was_scrubbed_from/). He has some connections to various occult conspiracies (the Finders, McMartin preschool), and this thread is the place where /x/philes get to the bottom of them.

>Why is there /x/ interested in him now?
There's been a somethingburger on him that was produced by a FOIA request I made. I received documents in response to the FOIA request, and they are available here: https://pastebin.com/3SQzFs98

People bitched about them being on a Discord in last thread, so there you go. To investigate them in real time, join the Discord: https://discord dot gg/x4K82F6fja

The files we've gotten so far show Aquino's connection to the a child sex-abuse case in 1986, where four children tested positive for Chlamydia at a daycare on the US Army base. They also show him trying to get the SFPD to stop investigating him.

But the interesting detail is how the FBI has abnormally large number of documents on him: nearly 5000 pages of files and 19 CDs worth of audio and video content. The government gives out some portion of files for free (the ones we got) and charges for the rest. I had to pay about 500 dollars for them, and they will first be posted in the Discord when I get my hands on them in a few days.

I've already done so several times, but here you go.

Me and my friend drove to an isolated spot near a creek to do some drinking. We feel like we are being watched when we pull up and park. A few minutes later, all we are doing is watching behind us (parked backwards to the woodline) and I see a pale white form standing out from the darkness. It's skin was like dry old dusty leather with varicose veins that are blue. I freak the fuck out and tell my friend to drive away. As we drive away me and him see the damn thing run across the road. It was incredibly fast and I saw it just barely long enough to make out its form. It was tall, had skinny arms and legs and a unusually small but round head (compared to its body). We drive away a few miles and it fucking follows us down the road, it kept up with the car.

We park at a lit parking lot that had cameras over it. It pops up a few hundred feet in front of us near some bushes and an unlit road. We take some pictures but they are of a quite shit quality for a multitude of reasons. Picrel is the one picture we got that shows something, a pair of eyes.

After an hour we decide to drive to the center of town to a 24/7 gas station for water and human contact (it was 2AM at this point). We exit the parking lot but are stopped at a light before the main road. To my right is a Grove of trees. Friend says he saw something moving over there.

My eyes adjust and I see the upper portion of its head peaking from behind a tree. It was staring directly at me. It eyes seemed huge but it was in fact it's eye sockets which absorb almost all incoming light. I couldn't look away and after a minute of probably the most horrifying, traumatic experiance of my life, I tell my friend to drive away. The moment I could no linger sustain eye contact I broke down into tears for about 30 seconds.

Words cannot fully describe how terrifying and evil these things are, and I had the luxury of encountering it from the safety of a car!

grew up in canada, and we had a channel called YTV, I think it's still around. But anyway, there was this show back in the mid 90s, with these 3 puppets, I think they were white and they each had different colored hair that was made from sparkly tassels or something. Anyway, there was a red one which I think was the leader, a blue one and a green one. For some reason I think they were a "band" or something. Only thing I can remember is them kinda bouncing around on a puppet stage thingy, with their hair flying all around. Very hazy memories of them, I've tried finding the show over the last 2 decades but I cannot find anything relating to it.
So, onto the good stuff. Around 1994 to about 1997 at the old house I lived in as a young kid, I would have these nightmares every night of these three. I am 30 now and can still remember some of them vividly. These dreams always felt very real and I always dreaded going to bed every night because I knew they would come.
They always started off with me in bed waking up at some point in the middle of the night after my mom had gone to sleep. I had a night light on and always had my radio on with the oldies channel on, so old boomer music from the 50's and 60's would be playing. So, I would awake in my racecar bed, which was facing the bedroom door and the only light would be from my night light, so pretty dim. I could see the hallway, the white walls were always a sorta nighttime blue hue and then blackness at the end of the hallway where the bathroom was with the stairs to the main floor off to the left. I would always be awake for a few moments and then I would hear voices coming from down stairs, like whispering voices, like mischievous they were up to no good. They would be talking coming to get me. Then I would hear running up the stairs and the three "puppets" from the show would come running from around the corner of the stairs into the hallway into my room to get me. I would wake up every time. Cont.

It would seem you would be indeed a quivk learner but also have difficulty with concentration and focus even when you know you should get to work on something and set yourself at the desk.

To better study, it would be good to, instead of procrastinating, integrate your personal research time and your study time and bounce back and forth. Trying to exclusively focus upon work for a session without the pressure of an imminent deadline may result in agitation to the point of abandoning studying altogether. So when studying alone, it might be good to spend 10 minutes on fun stuff, then switch to ten minutes of studying, then another break, etc.---making use of "breaks" but instead thinking of it as just doing both at the same time: multitasking.

You may also benefit from studying in a small group who have enough discipline not to let the study sessions get derailed.

If you have teammates you may be liable to rubbing them the wrong way or getting cross with them about something or other. Aquarius sun and ascendant both mean you're influenced by Aquarius energy. Your sun sign is your core identity, while your ascendant is how you present yourself to the world and your outer personality.

If you have an Aquarius sun, you'll probably be a rebel with a strong sense of self. You might be seen as unconventional or nonconformist, and you'll probably be really innovative and open-minded. You might be drawn to activities that allow you to think outside the box.

If you have an Aquarius ascendant, you'll PRESENT yourself as independent and offbeat. You might have a quirky or eccentric appearance, and you'll approach life and new experiences in a unique way. You might be detached and objective in your initial reactions to people and situations.

Your sun will show more in your sense of self, and your ascendant will show more in how you present yourself to the world.

BUT That said, it's not just you presenting it, people around you will see it magically due to astrology bullshit. Even if you're not quirky in any way, they'll still perceive you as it. >>33769702
There's a bit of a fractal in Astrology called derivative houses. The 12th house is stuff hidden from us, secret, subconscious etc. The 6th house is the 12th house from the 7th.

If you pretend the 7th house (relationships with others) is the first house, then it's 12th house is your 6th house if that makes sense. That's why it isolates as you're literally hidden from people.

Another thing that causes it is if your ruler of the 7th is actually in your 12th. Any house ruled by planets in the 12th gets hard shut down.

>be me, 8 y/o in small vermont town during the summer
>grandpa and great uncle like hiking mt equinox
>ive hiked a some of the trails for a couple of years at this point, going on hikes with them isnt uncommon
at this point i was borderline autistic, think of a kid with a big lollipop and propeller hat
>be hiking up to deer knoll

>get about halfway there on the way back
be thinking
>ive done this hike at least 20 times, i know this trail pretty well
>skip/sprint ahead away from grandpa and sister about 50 yards
>trail curves to the right just enough that they disappeared from eyeshot and earshot
>earshot
>realize the forest has gone completely silent. no birds, no wind. dead silence.
>get that feeling on the back of your neck, something was around and watching me
>remember my grandpa telling me about how birds stop chirping if a mountain lion is around
>look around, no lion.
>realize the trail looks really unfamiliar
>panic
>call out to grandpa
>no response
>try again
>still no response
>primal fear building inside me

>see grandpa and other family members

>freaking the fuck out
>try to scream, obviously doesn’t work
>can’t roll my eyes back far enough to get a good look at whatever is above/behind my head
>look over to my bathroom area
>my room connected directly to my bathroom/closet area, no door separating them
>see what is best equated as picrel lumbering into my fucking closet
>REALLY freaking out now
>the being behind me is now striding toward my door to leave my room
>I can see it now
>looks like a grey, but 7ft tall and pitch black
>I think it will kill my parents in the neighboring room
>all at once, my motor function and voice come back
>0-100 screaming absolute bloody god damn murder
>later learned my neighbors actually heard me
>thought there was a home invasion or that my dad murdered my mom or some shit
>I’m flailing like an epileptic, fall off bed onto floor in a heap
>piss everywhere
>parents immediately come in asking what the fuck happened
>do my best to describe my terror
>they say it was just a dream
>doubt.svg
>once I calm down and clean myself up, I notice my closet door is indeed open

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Very minor happening but I’ll keep it short and sweet

>finish closing down restaurant at end of a shift with friend/roommate
>he drives back to house and I ride my bicycle
>city’s laid out so that it’s often faster to bike than to drive, even with no traffic in the middle of the night like it was then
>i get home first and leave my bike propped up after entering, and using my phone’s flashlight, I do a quick sweep of each room of the house to check for spooky burglars or intruders
>i don’t turn on any lights and it is fully dark apart from my phone and my bike light which is still on
>make a loop of house which means 1st living room, 2nd living room, bedrooms, kitchen, back room, then back thru kitchen to get back to 1st living room, in that order
>while i am coming back through the kitchen, about five steps away from being back in the doorway of the 1st living room, I hear the distinct flicking sound of our lamp’s switch
>I jump a little bit because spooked, and then make it to the doorway to look into the 1st living room to see our lamp now on
>don’t know how long I stood staring at the lamp but probably less than 30 second later, my roommate pulls into the driveway and less than a minute from then he enters the front door
>I’m still standing there staring and spooked and i explain it to him
>we conclude that it was weird

it is a famously “haunted” city, and that is the closest I came to experiencing it as far as I can tell. Thanks for reading my uneventful but honest-as-possible tale

Not a story were anything really happens, but I´ve found an area that really feels...well, not "evil", but "bad" and everytime I visit, something slightly weird happens.
>be me, visiting girlfriends family, only for the 4th time in 7 years
>general area near the border of germany and both belgium and the netherlands
>also, interestingly enough, the very same area of the "boarrider"-greentext that ALWAYS gets reposted in these threads
>I take daily walks because I´m neither a family person, nor a very social person, so I need my me-time
>first time I visit there, I find a cut-down-tree in the middle of the forest, not even remotely close to any road or fields. It´s painted red, with immense red nails stuck in the top, holding a detailed human heart made from metal pieces
>second time visiting there, I awake in the middle of the night, people in robes are standing outside of the house the street over, some with instruments, some with torches, singing in front of the open door.
>third visit, I take a break on one of my walks, sit down on the stairs to a windmill, listen to music and read a bit. Three other wanderers walk by, just stop in front of me and stare at me for literaly 5 minutes without a word or even answering my "good day", then keep going. Happens two more times in the next hour before I get seriously freaked out and go home.
>fourth visit, same specific area where I found the "heart" and was observed by the weird wanderers, this time I find weird pieces of hap-hazardly built fences between trees in the forest, not even knee-high and completely useless, dozens of them. Last one I found was round instead of being set up between two trees and had this weird Golem-looking mud-puppet lying right in the middle.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
.cont
Those are not the only "weird" things that happened to me, there, but by far the most significant, everything else was very minor but adding to the feeling of wrongness.
I´m not an easily frightened person, but always get sudden pangs of intense fears when I walk around there.
I also always feel watched, both in the woods and in the cities around, hell, even when driving on the road.
Last visit was just last week, by the way.

Our house is very haunted, I'm very lucky to have a christian/gypsy/newage open minded neighbor.(I've told people about this) .

Since we moved in in March of last year we've had your usual footsteps and doors closing stuff you can kind of write off, but once my wife and I started seeing cups FLY across the room we knew it was a haunting. We have twice seen our baby asleep gently sucking her bottle only to have it RIPPED from her hands. She didn't move she didn't drop it it was physically ripped out of her hands.

one morning I was waking up at 5 or so in the morning and this thing slammed the door and for 30 or so seconds just sat there jiggling the handle back and forth I was thinking "yeah someone's gotta be fuckin with me, this is too long for this thing to maintain physically moving stuff" so I get up and look around to find everyone is sound asleep.

I'm usually the first guy up in the morning, so I go downstairs to do the needful. I hear a door and I hear footsteps approach the bathroom, so I hurry because I don't want to tie up the only bathroom my wife grandmother has access to.

Only to open it and find once again nobody is up I know I heard someone approach that door, it wasnt confirmation bias.
Multiple times I've been nudged out of my sleep because we think someone's in the house. Every time I sweep the home and theres nobody. So at this point I meet my neighbor and she believes me immediately and say she'll work on the house. The night she worked on the house was the most commotion we'd ever heard. But it worked for a few months nothing then I had a dream.

In the dream was this entity and he picked my then 8 month old son up and started to throw him until he was limp,this evil prick then starts making my sons limp body dance. I was yelling irl and in the dream "you're lucky you're dead or I'd fucking kill you" but I couldn't move it was pressing down on my chest. My screaming woke me up and I couldn't move.this was the only time I ever felt fear of it

Deus Ex is a fantastic game. I'm old enough that I played it when it came out, but I recently replayed it a few weeks ago. The story and detail of the conspiracies and a lot of the dialogue if you keep asking people is phenomenal.

The reason it predicted so much stuff is not because of predictive programming or the devs having secret knowledge, it's because they literally read conspiracy books of the time (stuff like Behold A Pale Horse had come out a few years before) and put everything in it.

The fact that conspiracy theorists are right about almost everything (as we've seen in the last 3 years) is why Deus Ex was so prophetic.

There is no way Deus Ex could be made now, there are too many people waking up to the truth. Back in the 90s these conspiracy theories were fringe knowledge known by crazies, whereas now we are in the ideological war stage and living in a dystopia of censorship and media control.

I think it's more that the lines are drawn differently. Back then you could assume an intelligent person knew about some of the different scams and schemes, and less intelligent people may or may not suspect them. There seemed to be some respect for people who knew about them, even if most people thought they were very rare.

Internet let everyone know about the basic details of all the scams and schemes, but now they actively split them up into conspiracy theories they believe (typical normies believe in any theories about a white hive-mind and white secret societies that create privilege) and conspiracy theories they don't believe (typical normies don't believe in any specific criminal or occult elements unless they're linked in with the white privilege complex). And just lately we've seen people go from being suspicious of big pharma (100% confirmed to have deliberately and consciously caused the opioid crisis, for one thing) to deciding they cannot possibly do anything wrong.

Back in the pre-Internet era, normies would believe any claim about conspiracies run by (for example) Soviet Russia, or Red China, or Islamic Terrorists, but similar things were impossible in their own country.

Protip: The parts of Deus Ex that you like were written by Sheldon J. Pacotti. He was the writer for the dialogue on Deus Ex 1 (all the red pilled shit you hear and the philosophy dork enlightenment stuff that /pol/ posts a lot.) He was the lead writer for IW and storywise it shows. It's honestly one of the most thought-provoking games I ever played storywise. Unfortunately, it's tied to a shitty game. IW is basically the revelation of the method, but it's so brutally honest about it that you admire it. It's basically saying all future choices suck, and while it wants you to take the Helios choice, it in no uncertain terms tells you it sucks and they all lead to roughly the same outcome besides the Templar ending. But I really think the Omar ending was secretly canon because it's off the beaten path and it's a bit more difficult to achieve (games easy regardless) than the other endings. It's also the only one narrated and basically says humanity reaches the stars, but at a heavy cost (you get your freedom and a good ending down the line, but you pay for it dearly.)

From the last thread
>33761737 I'll give an example to clarify what I'm trying to ask. So for example Mercury+Jupiter conjunction in 3rd house makes successful and renowned magicians. I don't remember seeing anything like that when it comes to Moon+Planet in x house, or when Moon is in a trine with X. Do you see what I mean?
>Or does it boil down to what you said initially about moon's influence being fleeting. Intuitively I think it shouldn't t b h especially since we are looking at how the moon is influencing and being influenced by other planets.

The moon is the nearest planet to earth, it is in a way the 'gateway' to the spiritual realm. It is also the fastest moving planet which is a major reason among many that it has traditionally been associated with emotions. When we look at a natal chart the first things we pay attention to is the Sun, Moon, and rising sign, then the conditions of the house rulers which will tell us how the planets in those houses will act. The moon is important for reading the major emotional and spiritual tendencies of the native (among other things of course). But because it ~is~ the closest planet its influence will be more, but not exclusively, on the mundane side. For spiritual and magical leanings of the native we must look at other aspects because spiritual and magical stuff is considered beyond the mundane earthly sphere, even if the aims of the magician are for sex and money or earthly power, the power for that comes from 'beyond'. I say that the moons influence for this topic is fleeting because IMO the changeableness of the moon and its connection to the changing emotions makes for unsustainable effort that is required for serious spiritual and/or magical pursuits. It certainly has some bearing on whether one is magically inclined, but it is only one minor piece of the puzzle and other factors can greatly modify its influence or completely nullify it. The same is true of the other planets aspects as well to a lesser degree.

posts.com: How do sigils physically work and why have I struggled to succeed with them?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33766531
The word comes from a Latinization of the Hebrew word Segullah/Segullot. The word means treasure, remedy, or protection. When it became a Latin concept, it took on a new meaning. They basically used it as a way to exert influence over the world through diagrams and circles. One good example of this would be the Sigilium Dei Ameth or the Sigil of the True God. Also Goetia/Lamegaton helped spread the current understanding of sigils, but it is not the original one.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33766546
I should also mention that Haitian Veve and Hindu Yantra have a similar function. There are subtle differences between them, but the concepts are worth a look. They might help you understand the idea a bit better. Also look into mneumonics or memory devices. At the heart of it, the occult is about making tools to work better and not harder.

I'm not exactly sure because the program seems largely identical. I think Grey has an inflated sense of how hard Andrew et al were making shit up and this is a "Narcissism of small differences" thing.

Now...that link is already interesting enough but the Dragon Book makes it super clear that more than zero people were VERY conversant with 1 Enoch Ilomiel (many spellings) is present in the text as a keeper of the secrets of the earth. One probably very outdated linguist has posited a link between that name and trees, which is a theme that runs through the Dragon Book as well. I've also found a few other very poorly cited religious stories/midrash/encyclopedia entries for "Ilomiel" or "Lumiel" or "Lumial" so like this concept does actually predate Howard hooking up with Andrew. That Grey does NOT notice this in his EXTENSIVE dive into the Enochic material tells me either this is stuff he hasn't considered or he's aware it erodes his arguments a bit and excludes it from his discourse.

What's REALLY interesting to me is that Howard, being the Fallen Angels cringelord with legit pre-Gardner chops, was NOT invited into the original core Column working the Dragon Book. So the relationship was definitely at least reciprocal, and there's a nonzero chance it was a situation where it was actually Andrew feeding lore to Mike Howard. Who knows tho at this point I'm kind of wildly speculating.

1. Fama Fraternitas Rosae Crucis
2. Confessio Fraternitatis
3. The Chymical Wedding of Christian Rosenkreutz
At Pansophers they also found 3 other core texts, one was written 2 years before the Fama Fraternitas!
1. The Reformation of the Whole Wide World by Order of Apollo
2. The Mirror of Wisdom of the Rosy Cross
3. Pegasus of the Firmament
Pansophy of the R.C
Basically the Rosicrucians were a small group who based themselves of Paracelsianism and Christian Kabbalah and had utopian ideas, think of them as one of the many 'third way' groups who rejected both Catholicism and Lutheranism like a lot of groups still existing today in the U.S

>>33769617
>>To learn to think speculatively, which is specified in the directive as the chief purpose of preparatory philosophical instruction, is thus surely to be seen as the necessary goal. Preparation for it is first abstract thinking and then dialectical thinking, and beyond that consists in attaining representations of speculative content.

>abstract thinking

John Locke defined abstraction in An Essay Concerning Human Understanding:

'So words are used to stand as outward marks of our internal ideas, which are taken from particular things; but if every particular idea that we take in had its own special name, there would be no end to names. To prevent this, the mind makes particular ideas received from particular things become general; which it does by considering them as they are in the mind—mental appearances—separate from all other existences, and from the circumstances of real existence, such as time, place, and so on. This procedure is called abstraction. In it, an idea taken from a particular thing becomes a general representative of all of the same kind, and its name becomes a general name that is applicable to any existing thing that fits that abstract idea.' (2.11.9)

You've got some good insights already so I won't add into those. Personal recommendation though, from dealing with my own trauma (not so much sexual altho that was a component, primarily social), is a two pronged approach involving occult methods and living out the spirituality in situ. So what I mean is connecting with spirits that seemed relevant, after observing my own inclinations and issues, and then in daily life living out the reality I wanted to create. I did find angelic invocations to be of great assistance, more so than planetary spirits. So what that looks like is noticing hey, I seem to be unable to perceive my own weaknesses, boon look up invocation to increase perception and self knowledge, oh that's say, metatron, do metatron work for a couple weeks. Then oh, I seem to be avoiding my problems, so I should display courage, that's a Michael thing, now Michael work for a week or two, and so on. Brand's "archangels of magic" offers a decent summary of what those qualities are I'm talking about, and it'll save you a lot of time if you get that, but the same info is in arbatel and other works.

posts.com:
>Letter 1 - 25th July 2005
Dear,
Thank you about your kind letter about the monster I spawned all those years ago. I have no idea who owns it, where its present incarnations rests, nor who profits from its sales to this day. Certainly not I, nor any of my former colleagues who worked on the game for about three years. One could almost say that it “died” under the same circumstances that gave it birth. One week it was #1 best selling game in the US, the following week Inscape folded and the game was buried. Conspiracy? I have no idea. I pulled the sequel Cult as I had no wish to return to the blood arena that is software publishing. No wish to return to that haunted city of Lost Angels. I feared that Cult had a dangerous side effect and the actions of Aum, The Solar Temple, and the Branch Davidians stayed my hand. I think it was a wise move. The world is too fucked up without me adding to it. I went back to writing children’s books and being an artist. But your letter is moving. I read it to my wife Mandy and she was pleased that somebody out there remembered it and enjoyed it. Drowned God was such a mammoth venture and it remains for me under the category of misunderstood. It’s beginnings were humble. A notebook that remained from 1983 when I penned the antique forgery The Diary of a Plagiarist and sold it (12 volumes) in the Cowgate, Edinburgh. A film of that episode was commissioned by Channel 4 but was once again thwarted. Ten years later I resurrected the basic premise for Drowned God. Time Warner bought the rights. The game was commissioned before the X-Files, suddenly what had seemed a left field minority interest was propelled into $3 million dollar flagship for Inscape. This was a pity, because it meant that much of what I had written was censored. Even the last realm of the game, Chokmah, is merely a 1/10 of what was made.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772879
The military temples and underground bunkers were reserved for Cult. Where they are now I have no idea. I was locked out of my own game. Indeed, so much was cut that I fear the story made no sense. Perhaps there is a fitting justice to all of this. My partners in the construction of Drowned God were seduced by promises of great wealth. The English producer made secret deals with Time Warner for a bigger portion of the pot. Film deals, 5 book deals with Eranta, a record deal, etc. A paid for and promised engine to realise a personal route through the game, devised on the numerology of the Bequest Globe, failed to materialise. For the nine personality types there were nine pathways. Even the running order of the Realms was changed, with Binah starting the game, where the original game had begun with Chesed, the Mayan realm. My original storyteller in the game, the Relic Hunter (Richard Horne) was cut and only makes a brief appearance in Din. It was through this character that all loose ends were tied and explained. When the game came out it was critically hailed and panned at the same time. Loved or loathed, my favorite quote from Playboy(?) who said it made The Twilight Zone seem like Pee Wee’s Big Day Out, the game languished for a month with sales of 100,000 before disappearing.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Letter 2 - 10th august 2005

Dear,
Your letter arrived this morning and awakened in me ideas that had for several years lain dormant. For the topographical inspiration for DG came from a dream and last night my dreams were disturbed by low visions of military temples and unholy crypts, shifting sands over barren deserts and forgotten decaying landscapes. Your letter added to the feeling that something in me had shifted and despite my resolution that this umbrageous legacy should remain closed, sealed, something in your perceptions about the horrific endings of Kether and Malchut was resurrected...
Perhaps my dreams are informed by my current nocturnal readings.
The Shadow Over Innsmouth by HP Lovecraft, a tale of mingled terror and fascination set in the decaying seaport towns of New England; fishy hybrids and ancient secrets locked in extraterrestrial vaults under the spume of troubled waters. All those abandoned wharves and warehouses crumbling into the sea. Crooked eaves and terror soaked inhabitants scuttling to preserve the secret from prying outsiders, all grist for the mill for my own febrile imagination, the foundations for which our nightmares are built upon. Blame myself for making that ground fertile, for allowing the seeds of horror to find dark soils worthy for those’ mares to take hold, but wether I read Mailer, Henry Miller or that mad mage the crafty one, still am I troubled. Like the ten year old boy I once was I enjoy scaring myself to sleep, though the waking moments at 3.am promise hat filled cranial machinations. I am a cosmanaut venturing into the unknown inner spaces of the unconcious. I bring back scattered fragments of the dream and try to weave some semblance of coherance.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772895
The first dream in 1981 informed the making of 'Diary of A Plaguarist', the 18th century manuscript describing the fall of Atlantis and the subsequent cyphers of the secret, complete with the rival factions who vie for control. In those days my knowledge of the arcane and occult was minimal. The work was simply to acquire a sum from the pompous booksellers in the capital. I was poor and the income I generated as an artist was minimal. Finding blank papers in a drawer and soaking them in tea produced a pleasing antiquarian effect. My copperplate handwriting ( enclosed sample, only a copy I am afraid) and emulation of illustrations of that time provided decent subterfuge. I produced 11 chapters or manuscripts, thusly decorated. Each copy bound and sewn. Orange juice to culture a mould on the covers. Dust from the fireplace scattered on those mouldering covers. Greased endpapers mothballed and tinctured, even the smell was authentic. Let me explain that my real name is Richard Horne ( though for reasons I shall not enter into here I prefer to be recognised by my nom de plume) and for the purposes of disgusing the true authorship of these manuscripts I simply spelt that name backwards- hence Dracir Enroh, dated 1846.

The contents of the Diary were rambling and nonsensical. I was merely after the prize. Selling the diaries as they were produced very fortnight to a dealer called Armstrong. He was taken with the look of the books and offered me the sum of £ 50 for each one( a pittance, but fortune for me) on the understanding that I bring him all 12 in due time. He believed as I had told him that the manuscripts belonged to my father and were kept in a drawer of his bureau, and that it was necessary for me, so as not to arouse suspicion, that I remove them one by one, with a period of weeks between each theft. Colluding with me in this way I was given ample time to concoct the latest version.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772902
At first the Diaries were concerned with the Blavatskian ramblings of the Theosopshists. As you have so rightly noted, the ramblings of the Relic Hunter, much given to discourse upon Atlantean airships and manimals. After three volumes cyphered in this manner, replete with diagrams and maps of the citadel, pages filled with Sumerian cryptograms and number codes, German expressionist poetry copied from unread books on the subject, I began to exhaust my small library and turned instead to filling the pages with diagrams from a nuclear fission handbook from a power station, engineering blueprints for aeroplanes and other delights into the handbook of a modern Nostradamus. Joyfull as this was to the japester in me, it was my final undoing. I had been carefull to select a bookdealer who dealt in bric-a-brac, rather than an authentic expert in antiquarian books. The inclusion of these groundbreaking discoveries whetted the appetite of Armstrong. This unpublished manuscript made the work of HG Wells seem like the blind musing of a pulp writer. Here, afterall, were the rudimentary and accurate sketches for a fission, nearly a hundred years before the discovery by modern science. Here, the dates of the two great wars and the descriptions of the vessels that would carry those dread payloads. Turn a page and see the blueprints for the aeroplane, the tank, the motor car. And unlinke Nostradamus, the names of the players. Not Hister but Hitler. Armstrong the dealer went to his fortune. He took my forgeries to a publisher.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772906
I believe in synchronicity, not coincidence. The 23 Skidoo Principle. Schroedinger's Cat. Call it what you will. I should tell you that I was already a published author and illustrator in the employ of Canongate Publishers. Indeed I took some of the manuscripts there to be photocopied. I was working on drawings for 'Jekyll and Hyde' (pub. Canongate 1985) and would mix up these and the secretive workings of my efforts to preserve something of my labours - for posterity. Armstrong took my seven manuscripts to an expert called Dr.Black (I kid you not) who in turn took them to Christie's, the internationally held experts in the field of antiques - and rare manuscripts etc.

Now here is the strange part. Unknown to me there really was a writer called Richard Horne who was working in 1846. His most famous book is called Orion, a verse poem recalling the slaughter of the Sons of God by Diana the Huntress in Merope. He was born in 1803 and his last book written in 1884 was called 'Sithron the Star Stricken', subtitled, a 12th century manuscript discovered under the ruin of Solomon's Temple, translated from the ancient Arabic manuscript by Salem Ben Uzair (really Richard Horne). Orion was published in 1846. The expert was convinced that this was one of his forgeries of japes. Thrilled, Armstrong took my manuscripts to the first publisher he could find... Canongate. I was discovered ofcourse and prosecution was threatened. A deal was struck in the musty backroom of the shop. I was to provide the rest of the manuscripts at a reduced cost. It served me right I suppose. I only wrote up to the 11th Diary of A Plaguarist and then escaped to France.

'I pray the lord Christ's pardon, having found,

Now I must return to my daily work though even writing this letter has whetted my appetite for further discussions. I am intrigued by your ideas. More...More..more. For classical psychedelics: disagree.
I guide trips often with new people. You want a tiny dose, enough to be in the headspace of who you are guiding, it 100% makes it easier to guide them properly especially if something fucks up. You just can't take a full dose.
I generally do shrooms first (6 hours vs 12 with LSD) and I can take 2--3 grams, be in the headspace and somewhat tripping, and still guider perfectly well. I've tried sober and it doesn't work, because you try to use sober logic guide someone in a psychedelic headspace, and it just doesn't work. Meanwhile, if you are in that same space, you can say the weird shit that just absolutely works. I've guided several people back from a bad trip this way; sober, I haven't been able to connect with them to guide them back.
You have to be experienced, totally sure of the trip (no bullshit in your life that might drag you down), and be on a low enough dose to not be fucked up if your trip randomly goes south, which can definitely happen.

Simple extraterrestrial life such as algaes, planktons, amoebas, maybe even simple surface vegetation, is probably very common- maybe even abundant. I wouldn't be surprised if such organisms were found in subterranean Mars, underneath the ice of Europa, and in the atmosphere of Venus. Life seems to be extremely persistent, adaptable, and essentially impossible to permanently eliminate once conceived.
I'm expecting complex extraterrestrial life (things with bones) to be far less common, but not exactly rare. Animals might be a "once per solar system" kind of occurrence: only propagating on the most consistent climate-controlled kind of "goldilocks" planet in a given system.
