There probably is life on other planets (and all life is intelligent in some way) but I don't they've visited earth. Classic UFO sightings have been going on since the 1940s so if this was some alien empire, they would've conquered us or sent a delegation by now.

If we look at the details of a lot of abduction reports, we can see tons of overlap with old folklore about fairies and demons. The classic contactee experience is someone who's told by benevolent aliens that humanity needs some sort of new global order that will bring world peace. And there's a long history of glowing ufologists putting the idea out there that aliens created all human religions, which is also something that "aliens" themselves sometimes tell contactees, and something that the deep state has been openly pushing in the last 5 years or so (look into To the Stars Academy).

If you plug all that into a wider conspiracy framework I think it's pretty clear that the UFO/alien phenomena is part of a one world government and one world religion agenda. A lot of encounters are probably faked, some might be cover for advanced weaponry, but I think there's enough evidence for us to believe that there really is something up there. But they're spirits, not aliens, and the ones who contact and abduct people are clearly not well-intentioned ones.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33748589
yeah, this. also, each day/month/year is continually growing shorter in relation to your total time spent on this earth.
one year for a two year old is 50% of their life, but one year for a twenty year old is 5% of their life.
let yourself be bored more often, or do things that move you away from your routine.
if you do the same thing every day, then it's obvious that at some point they'll melt together and an entire year can feel like one very long, blurry day.
you don't have to adopt the "yolo live every day like its your last" mindset and go to the extremes of literally living each day differently, but you could break your time into chunks, if that makes sense.
so, for me, something that helps me "slow down" my clock is by breaking things up into the seasons. in the spring, i spend a lot of time preparing my garden.
during summer, i spend a lot of time outside both enjoying my garden and tending to it. i also spend a lot of time 'experiencing the world' by going camping, on bike rides, walks at night
in the autumn, i start to harvest the majority of what i've planted (lots of smaller things get harvested throughout the year), then i start cleaning everything and putting it into compost.
then, i use winter as a time to hunker down and reflect.

basically, enrich your life with more variety but also give yourself time to be bored and do nothing. then you'll actually enjoy the mundane and it won't morph itself into some weird caricature.

I made a thread about this a few weeks ago, because I noticed it too. Nothing conclusive was reached (tons of people saying "it's just you getting old bro"), but a good point is that the usual memonics for counting time like 1-mississippi-2mississippi are off by about 30%, and people in general feel like time flows about 30% faster.

I have no idea what is going on, but I do wonder about some things:

>2 Peter 3:11-23
>11Since everything is to be dissolved in this way, what sort of persons ought [you] to be, conducting yourselves in holiness and devotion, 12[a]waiting for and hastening the coming of the day of God, because of which the heavens will be dissolved in flames and the elements melted by fire.

>Matthew 24:21-22
>21For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be. 22And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days shall be shortened.

> Daniel 7:25
> And he shall speak great words against the most High, and shall wear out the saints of the most High, and think to change times and laws: and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and the dividing of time.

>Since everything is to be dissolved
>dissolved in flames and the elements melted by fire.
>hastening the coming of the day of God
2 Peter describes what sounds like a fundamental breakdown of the laws of physics holding things together. The 'hastening' is usually interpreted as doing things to fulfill the prophecy, but what if it's suggesting time starts breaking down too?

>those days should be shortened
Again, the usual interpretation is that God ordained a period of tribulation, then cut it by some amount so the elect should survive, but that's a weird bit of indecision. What if he adjusted the flow of time so people are 'gimped' and can't do as much during that period, partly so we don't wipe ourselves out with biotech for example.

Part 1/2

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33772285
>But as one anon said, it can also more easily lead to heavy distraction and complacency.

I think most significantly it leads to suppression if not repression of worries of the future. Tolle would maybe give the impression that a lack of worry over the future would be a good thing, but this isn't true because that could mean that one thing can go wrong, such as the person losing their security, and they have to start their lives when they're 40. That means they'd go from NEET with a warm bed, to having to find full time work. Or perhaps the parents die and when they are 50 it dawns on them that they are going to die alone with no one, and they look in a mirror and see an old man, and feel a sense of disgrace and shame in their lives and what happened.

I think most NEETS are aware of those facts, but just suppress them. But this anxiety is natural for an unhealthy situation. Yeah worrying is bad, but worrying can also be a motivating factor in life.

The big problem i think is not people living in the past and future, but instead it is that society is filled with unhealthy imbalance. There is too much crime, people can't depend on one another anymore. People are thrown out on the street for nothing. People can't find gainful employment. You are seen as nothing and unworthy of love unless you have such and such an amount of money. None of that is solved merely by living in the now. It helps, but too much living in the now means that we don't look at our lives and think how it could change. we don't look at the world and how we can change it, etcetera.

I find that unconvincing and I believe anyone who tries it would find the same thing. Imagine walking in the rain and telling yourself it is a sunny day. "Ah what a blissfully warm day it is!" you say, as you are drenched with rain and soaked to the skin. It is incongruous with a million other perceptions that you do not truly believe do not correlate to reality. Osman's discussion of the laws and how by affirming one thing constantly and consciously you actually affirm the exact opposite (I am so rich! So rich! I studied a lot of psych and some of my occult work gave me a good background on this. That said some of the Anons here have posted good and simple solutions for it:

1. Do your manifestation and feel/listen to the negative feedback you are getting. You may get even something as straightforward as "I don't deserve a good woman because X happened to me." This can give you places to start working on yourself

2. Start loving yourself and manifesting love/happiness/contentment into your life. This can help with a lot of issues. If you can manifest money that helps with a lot more if you have lived with poverty

3. Use LOA to remove blocks. Yes, this actually works because you are blocked for the specific operation, not all manifesting. You can usually manifest a solution or at least information to help fix it. Believe the block is in the past or just believe it away directly or assume it is easy to resolve

Some posters in this thread will disagree with me on this and perhaps rightly so but I like to know what went wrong before I fix it. Others will say "Why does it matter? Your perfect future is here."

>"In the beginning, people who are in financial difficulties do not get results with such affirmations as, “I am wealthy;” “I am prosperous.” “I am successful”; such statements may cause their conditions to get worse. Beyond just Jesus as an example, read any story about someone in the Bible. Take Moses, who clashed with Pharaoh, or Daniel, who had to face a king's punishments, or David, who fought Goliath and many other battles. The point is, anyone that serves God, and thus, becomes mentally strong enough to witness miracles, must first prove themselves by overcoming great trials in their lives. This is the simple nature of being "adept", in that being an adept means that you become good at solving problems, and the only way that can happen is for you to constantly face bigger problems.

Psalm 76:1-3 (KJV)
>In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel. In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion. There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.

Israel is the exalted city, and in this case, it represents the exalted part of your mind. Same goes for (Jeru)Salem (where Melchizedek hails from, who was the saviour of the angels, and so Salem represents a heavenly place), and Zion also is a holy city on a hill. What these are telling you is that to reach God, your mind has to be lifted and raised. Then, once you train your mind to be higher, holier, then your conflicts will fall apart. It's not that you won't face conflict when you become more enlightened, but your problems will be easily dealt with. You will sweep over them, breaking any "weapons" and even the "battle" itself.

1 Peter 1:6-7 (NIV)
>In all this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while you may have had to suffer grief in all kinds of trials. These have come so that the proven genuineness of your faith—of greater worth than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire—may result in praise, glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.

This is a very explicit passage that tells you that to prove yourself of a well-trained mind (the true meaning of "meek" in the Bible), you develop such a mind through beating problems.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33766019
>The opposite of this is micromanaging every step in the way you think it something should be done, but doing this seems like statement that you don't trust it can get done on its own (though you or others).
>Thoughts on this? Or some sources of similar ideas I can read about?
I don't have any reading material on this, but one way I was taught to practice was to make a list of 6 things every night that I wanted done by the end of the next day (supposedly related to the 6 days of Creation, so don't change that number). The thing about this list of 6 is that everything has to be composed of things that you're trying to manifest, but then you also have to be able to finish the task "manually" or "physically" yourself. So for example, you would plan out a specific food item you would want for lunch the next day.

What ends up happening is that early on, maybe one or none of those things happen on their own. However, by completing the tasks repeatedly, regardless of whether they'll manifest "by themselves", you're telling your subconscious mind "these things are going to done because I say so". Once you get into the habit of this, you'll notice that these things will eventually get done in the "background", as in you won't even have to imagine a scene for them getting done, you can just focus on your "big" goals, and then a bunch of other more trivial tasks you want done will also come together.

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

>feminine sexuality and other weird stuff
For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

My brother is the strongest man I know. If I can be strong in his eyes even without training after 7 years of having less testosterone than most women, then I shouldn't belittle myself.
So I've decided to start working out and learn martial arts. It doesn't matter if I won't be as strong as I'd have been as a man; transitioning gave me other things that are more important to me. Even so, I still want to become my best self.

I attempted physical transmutation a few years ago, as I was curious whether it might work. However, I discontinued my efforts after a few weeks, as it caused severe inflammation and pieces of dead skin falling off in a particular area. Not only was the pain becoming unbearable, but I realised what I was doing was highly dangerous, as it was becoming difficult to even urinate. After discontinuing my magick, which consisted of daily energy work in a deep trance, the symptoms subsided in just a day.

My conclusions are that it's far more efficient to change physical things by physical means, and spiritual things by spiritual means. Not only that, but it's dangerous to attempt to remove body parts with magick; it's no different from convincing those parts of your body to destroy themselves, with no guarantee of actually getting the results you want. In my experience, physical surgery is both safer and much less painful in comparison. However, based on other results I got such as a sudden spurt of breast growth, I do think it can be useful for healing.

You posted here a while ago and clarified that you're not interested in physically transitioning, nor in changing spiritually. Perhaps it could be useful for you to try to understand why you think you want to be a biological woman, and find (other) positive ways for you to fulfil the underlying needs.

posts.com:
The Mary Celeste departed New York City on November 7th, 1872, headed for northern Italy. About a month later, she was found floating adrift near the Azores Islands off the coast of Spain. Her entire crew was missing, along with the only lifeboat.
She had apparently been left in an extreme hurry, because there were no signs of any kind of struggle, and she was well stocked with plenty of provisions. The last entry in the captain's log was dated 10 days prior to her discovery. To this day, no trace of her crew has ever been found, nor is it known why they abandoned her.

posts.com:
Klubbis was a black cat with eyes that shone like glowing embers. It was said that he had the power to bring about the end of times, and that he would only appear when the world was on the brink of destruction.

According to legend, Klubbis would appear out of nowhere, his presence heralded by a sudden chill in the air and the sound of his eerie meows. He would roam the land, seeking out those who had brought about their own downfall and causing them to meet their demise.

As he prowled through the streets, Klubbis was feared by all who saw him, for it was said that anyone who looked into his glowing eyes would be doomed to suffer a terrible fate.

But despite his fearsome reputation, there were those who said that Klubbis could also bring about salvation. It was said that if one could capture the black cat and bring him to the right place at the right time, he could be used to prevent the end of the world and bring about a new era of peace and prosperity.

Many brave souls attempted to capture Klubbis, but none were successful. And so, the legend of the black cat Klubbis lives on, a cautionary tale of the power of the fates and the dangers of tempting them.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Leigh Occhi (13) disappeared from her home in Tupelo, Mississippi on August 27, 1992 during the impact of hurricane Andrew. Her mother, leaving her desk job to check on her daughter before a storm from the hurricane hit her house. She found the garage door open and the lights on, when her entered the house she found blood smeared on the wall and her daughter's favorite blanket in the floor. Law enforcement found more blood in the bedroom, bathroom and on clothes in laundry basket, also the house showed no signs of forced entry.
On September 9, Occhi's glasses were mailed to the family from Booneville, Mississippi 5 days after a mc Donald's employee claim to have saw her at the restaurant.
No one has officially be charged and the child still remains unfound.

posts.com:
The Man in the Iron Mask is the name given to a French prisoner, held in various prisons for 34 years until his death in 1703. It has been reported that the prisoner, whose identity and even criminal charge are unknown, was forced to wear a mask at all times during his incarceration.
The term "Iron Mask" is considered a mistake; most believe his mask was actually made of cloth.

The USS Cyclops set sail from Brazil on February 22nd, 1918, bound for Baltimore, Maryland. Carrying about 20 million pounds of manganese ore, she never arrived at her destination, and her wreckage has never been found.
The Cyclops had three sister ships. Two of these, the Proteus and the Nereus, also vanished without a trace during World War II.

Pedro Alonso López also known as the Monster of the Andes is a Colombian murder and child rapist who killed at least 110 girls and had claimed to murder over 300 across Colombia, Peru and Ecuador.

After a murder in 2002, Colombian authorities have re instated a manhunt for him, but he has so far not been located.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>2.)
That's sleep paralysis followed by HH. Your body fell asleep while your mind was awake so it layered dream hallucinations on top of it.
>The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe
Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

>Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
Of course time exists. What I meant was that (as you said) the only reason a day is 24 hours and a year is 365 days is due to the rotation of the earth and how long it takes to orbit the sun. Dreams however are different though. You can experience a years worth of time in half a night, or even more. It doesn't make much sense to assume that time works the same way within a dream.
>For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed
Furthermore to elaborate how do you measure the time on earth from within a dream? From within a dream it is impossible to measure time in this world since they're not even on the same realm.
Let me put it this way for you. Assume both Earth and Venus have the same starting date of Day 1, year 1 upon Earth reaching AD on the calendar. Can you tell me what year and month it is on Venus currently without looking it up? This isn't even taking into account the finnicky nature of time in a dream. So pretty much my whole point is that it makes no sense a person in a dream would ever know what the date here is.

is thinking while sleeping linked to lucid dreaming?

it's a form cognitive processing that resembles rumination and autistic problem-solving mental language, that happens while sleeping. i usually wake up still remembering what i was thinking about, and oftentimes i remember conclusions i reached far before i woke up, while using this way of thinking.

the other day it got more weird though. i caught myself (became one extra layer of lucid, sort of) thinking about Baudrillard's Simulation and Simulacra and i saw that i could release control of the train of thought with it still functioning. i tried to shift my consciousness back upon myself to hopefully identify the source of this thinking, but to no avail.
i then thought: "what if I don't snap out of it and wake up like i usually do, rather what if i were to speed the train of thought?"
well i managed to speed it up, and words soon became fast moving concepts, symbols and images, like fast forwarding a movie reel. there was a constant sense of direction of where the thoughts were going, and it felt like a straight road ahead, or a laser filled with thoughts that shot onwards into infinity.

it started moving so fast i couldn't control and/or understand it anymore, so when i decided to let go of it, it snapped off of the point of creation within myself. i watched the last thought i had go away into a fixed point on the horizon of the darkness of my closed eyes, and i was left in the most peaceful silence and the widest, emptiest and cleanest headspace i had in months.
when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?
or anyone has some resources i could look into?

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

My coworker saw what happened and asked if I was ok. I told him to give me a minute. He agreed and waited by my side. I took a second to clear my head and I thought about making the pain go away and within the span of probably 10 seconds the pain slowly faded away. I was completely shocked so I tried to stand up and collapsed from the new pain in my leg. My coworker told me he was going to call for help but despite my protest, he did anyway. It took a few minutes with nothing happening but eventually, I got this sickening feeling in my gut and the weirdest feeling in my leg. I gave standing up another try and with a little wobble, I stood on my leg again with no problem. My coworker saw the whole thing happen and was completely flabbergasted. Start by taking logical steps, assuming your not joking you may have been kidnapped, use any cell or internet service you have to broadcast your location to the authorities. Calling a 911 operator and remaining quiet would be the place to start.

>>33772198
Assuming your situation has become more dire, I would recommend:
A. Remain Alert. Quietly observe your surroundings and calm down. You'll need to reserve energy so sprinting or screaming is a bad idea. Calmly and neatly take count of your options.
B. Broadcast your location. Call family and friends, contact authority figures and keep your cellphone online. If that fails familiarize yourself with the area and make a safe zone to start mapping out the complex. If you don't have paper any marker will do draw, cut, place or modify in any way you can to mark paths you've been before.
C. Create a basecamp, account for any materials you have such as food water and electricity. Stay put, if you go missing and can talk to people help is on the way. Running for miles is only going to make things worse.

Your goal now is to stockpile supplies and slowly build up a map of the area. Good luck man.

t. SAR trained Eagle Scout

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
here's some of my auto therapy:
I look at my life from inside my head like the me that's up there vs. the me that's out here. I'm supremely stressed but also disengaged from what's happening. me up here is watching a movie about me out there but it's an interactive one where I get to shout out shit that influences the plot. stress/engagement is an extremely fulfilling yin/yang, it gets me through anything.
I'm looking forward to death, not in a depressed way just more of, if you really think about it, it's a very exciting thing to finally get to experience the final transition and see what ends up happening.
I think one of the most important things we should strive for in life is to make sure our death is dignified.
I like to deprive myself of sleep for 3 days and then on the fourth, the sleep is so good that waking up is like being reborn.
I feel like I've been alive forever.
I like to go for runs where the intention is to make myself hurt. When I work out I visualize moving blood to different parts of my body.
On my birthday each year I go for a really long walk and imagine a room where there's a version of me from each year and we mingle and talk and I reflect on how all the annual past versions of myself would interact with the current version of myself.
I make sure any space where I sit for more than an hour is surrounded by plants. It's really nice to see the way different plants grow.
that's most of the important things that I can think of right now

https://www.cincinnati.com/storytelling/graphic-novel/accused-podcast/death-david-bocks-fernald/
>the town of Fernald outside of Cincinnati housed a secret government plant that processed weapons-grade uranium
>in 1984 it was revealed that radioactive smoke from the plant was poisoning the surrounding area.
>several months before the story breaks, a worker dies under mysterious circumstances
>Dave Bocks, a pipefitter and maintenance worker, knew about the radioactive smoke. The pipes he worked on in Plant 8 were where the smoke was coming from
>one June evening, a coworker sees Dave and a supervisor having a heated discussion in a parked car with the windows rolled up despite the heat
>he later sees Dave walking towards Plant 4. Remember that he was assigned to Plant 8. This was the last time he's seen alive.
>the coworker, before leaving, notes that Dave's toolbox is open with his personal keys inside
>next morning, Dave is missing. The coworker sees that the toolbox and keys are still there at 7am
>meanwhile the morning crew of Plant 6, which houses the furnace, notes unusual residue and a strange smell. Management tells them to ignore it.
>Dave is reported missing. Investigation reveals that the temperature in Plant 6's furnace dropped at 5am. The temperature would drop if something was put into it
>the furnace is cooled and Dave's remains are found. Remember that he was assigned to Plant 8, not 6.
>his personal keys, which a coworker had seen at 7am the day after he vanished, are somehow in the furnace, still somewhat intact. His coworker swore that these keys were in Dave's toolbox a full two hours after the temperature drop, and were removed by a supervisor during the investigation.
>steel wire looped into circles was also recovered, as if used as restraints
Dave may have been murdered as part of an attempted coverup of the radioactive smoke

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taman_Shud_Case

>December 1st, 1948
>Unidentifiable dead man found dead sitting on the beach at 6:30am
>Nothing on his person except for an unlit cigarette behind his ear and a half smoked one sitting in the collar of his shirt, a search of his pockets found only a used bus ticket, an unused train ticket, bubble gum, a branded packet of smokes (Army Club) with a different brand of smokes inside (Kensitas)
>Bus stop related to ticket was within 1km of where he was found
>Well dressed with all the tags removed from his clothes
>Was seen the previous night not far from where the body was discovered
>Dental records did not match any known person
>The autopsy failed to detect any foreign substances inside his body, his heart and blood vessels a normal size, despite there being blood mixed with the food inside his stomach and his kidneys and stomach being heavily congested

>Found inside a hand sewn pocket on the inside of the man’s pants was a tiny, rolled up piece of paper with the words "Taman Shud" on it
>The words "Taman Shud" translate to "ended" or "finished" and were the closing lines in a book named The Rubaiyat and followed this poem:

And when thyself with shining foot shall pass
Among the Guests Star-scatter'd on the grass
And in your joyous Errand reach the Spot
Where I made One – turn down an empty Glass!
>A man allegedly found the original copy that police believe had belonged to the dead man on the back seat of his car on the morning the man’s body was discovered
>On the back page was a series of "codes" faintly hand written with the MLIAOI line crossed out:

WRGOABABD
MLIAOI
WTBIMPANETP
MLIABOAIAQC
ITTMTSAMSTGAB

posts.com:
practice mindfulness. silent mind. you busy your mind with perceptions of your body and the world. focus on what is focusing. become aware of the awareness itself. when you hear a thought, do not focus on the content of the thought or the voice, focus on what it is that allows that thought to even exist or to be perceived.

think to yourself now: who is thinking my thought? is it me? who am I?

notice that in-between asking yourself these thoughts there is a pure silence. you can learn to expand that and stay inside it. the feeling you will have when you drop all concepts, thoughts, and language is one of wonder, or 'ahhh', joy.

I have schizoaffective disorder and often a defeatist mentality. I'm not currently psychotic. I'm working on myself.

I am scared and sad a lot. I am afraid to try anything, but not trying is also failure. My willpower is not enough to make me do what I should do all the time, because I suffer, and I do things that lessen the suffering like playing video games and eating food when I should be fasting.

I am afraid to do anything that doesn't distract me from my negative thoughts or that might trigger unwanted feelings such as new movies, books, or shows.

I am very depressed and scared of my own shadow. I try to do things that I think will help me avoid feeling suicidal or telling myself negative things.

I am new to practicing magic and mostly make it up as I go along, which is how I assume all traditions started. I also have gotten back into syncretic religion and fusing eastern and western philosophical and esoteric approaches. All this helps to create a tranquil positive mental attitude affirmimg thag I can accomplish realistic things.

Basically I'm trying whatever I can that doesn't hurt so much it makes me want to die or so anxious I have panic attacks. My goal is to improve myself and finish college.

I want to believe that I am not inferior for having mental illnesses. I feel like I have to be better than people who don't have a disability to prove something or maybe to become worthy of love.

The perfect, endless God decided to create spirits, so he split into many different small parts, leaving a piece of himself in each spirit. Then he decided to create for them a material world, so he split into 2 now - God and the Demiurge (aka Satan).
The Demiurge, tasked with creating a material world, had delusions of being greater than God, and refused to cooperate, so he created a material world alone (out of himself), but it was imperfect as he overestimated his abilities, so the spirits were bound to a world of suffering, to suffer along with the Demiurge, who now tries to pursue spirits to stay in the material world (that's why he's also called Satan).
God (no longer omnipresent now, since he split his energy) sent down a vision to one man, who was taught how to escape - the first Buddha, whose teachings would later influence the religion of Buddhism (a true, yet incomplete religion).
Then he sent another prophet (Jesus Christ) to further spread the message (here Christianity was born out of wrong interpretations), so that all the spirits can become disillusioned with the material world and escape the cycle of rebirth.
All other religions are just incomplete or wrong interpretations of this reality, that's why many religions share similarities - they are partially right.
Once all the spirits are enlightened (escape the cycle), they join a great ritual in the other plane (the non-material, aka spiritual) and once again are joined in God, who then consumes the energy of the Demiurge, destroying the material world (aka the Demiurge), and returning everything into peace once again.

All this knowledge has been revealed to me in dreams and meditations, it is the one and only truth.
Spread the word, teach compassion, teach how to escape suffering (see Buddhism on how to escape), spread the word of God and the prophets, and eventually we'll all be free.
